snippet: The theft of tax information from a South Carolina computer system appears to have been the largest cyberattack ever on a state government.
abstract: Theft of tax information from a South Carolina computer system appears to have been the largest cyberattack ever on a state government; state announced that an international hacker had stolen 3.6 million Social Security numbers and 387,000 credit and debit card numbers; tax departments across the country are inspecting their own security systems following the breach.
lead_paragraph: The theft of tax information from a South Carolina computer system appears to have been the largest cyberattack ever on a state government.

headline.seo: South Carolina Tax Hacking Puts Other States on Alert
headline.main: Hacking of Tax Records Has Put States on Guard
headline.print_headline: Hacking of Tax Records Has Put States on Guard
